interestingFact: Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,080 kilometers.
Japan consists of 14,125 islands, with Honshu being the largest.
The Amazon Rainforest in Brazil is the largest tropical rainforest globally, covering over 5.5 million square kilometers.
Australia is home to more kangaroos than people, with an estimated kangaroo population of 50 million.
Egypt's Great Pyramid of Giza is one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World and the only one still largely intact.
France is the world's most visited country, attracting over 89 million tourists annually.
India is the world's largest democracy, with over 1.3 billion citizens.
South Africa is the only country to have hosted the soccer, cricket, and rugby world cups.
Russia spans 11 time zones, more than any other country.
Mexico introduced chocolate, chilies, and chilies to the world.
